message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with natural language processing tasks such as entity classification and relation extraction. Additionally, the use of linear-chain conditional random fields is a common technique in this field. 

It is also likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) because the paper proposes a novel approach to utilizing convolutional neural networks for joint entity and relation classification. 

Furthermore, the use of global normalization is a technique commonly used in neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another likely sub-category. 

Finally, since the paper deals with image-based entity and relation classification, it may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision).
